Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2018 03:15PM Puzzlewoman wrote: I’m sorry to hear you’re going through this. In my area there is a cancer support community that is fully funded through grants and donations, visitors are never charged. They have been such a huge support to me, like a family. And even though I’ve lived here all my life, I didn’t know it existed until a nurse navigator told me. Maybe there is something like this near you? Best wishes ❤️
Posts.Title: No treatment other then surgery? Jadedjo Jadedjo

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2018 09:49PM Puzzlewoman wrote: I’m not sure. I have a one month post-treatment f/up appt with my rad onc in a coupe weeks. Do you have that scheduled? I would ask them because as far as I can tell everyone’s skin reacts differently but over time I thought these “scars” would go away. I hope so anyway!
Posts.Title: Radiation "scars"? star2017 Bagsharon
